reviewText: We love Leslie's walks! We've done them together as a family for several years, and we love that she's always coming out with new walks with different music and moves.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I just started this today - borrowed from library, so I have only done the Burn 30 Workout.  It was fun!  I am sweating!  The music starts out as elevator music but it works for the warm up, and then it goes in to some fun music which you just can't help but "cha cha cha" and bounce, bounce, bounce to.  I enjoy the skater slide, felt it in my thighs and will probably feel tomorrow.  I enjoy the cha cha cha and the bounce bounce bounce - they work with this workout.Leslie is so upbeat and happy to be moving.  There are a variety of ages here and a few men, which is nice to see them sweat to something they may have thought was simple.The last 10 minutes, a clock appears as a countdown.  At the 3 minute mark she starts doing squats.  Now normally, I won't do these during a high paced walk - but this is during the cool down.  So I did them and I was fine with them.  She maybe only did them twice between slow walking.One reviewer mentioned an older lady, in back, not being able to keep up.  I don't see it that way.  I see someone who did this low impact and she kept moving even if she didn't do the bouncing or the skater moves, she walked  - she kept moving.  That is what these motivational DVDs are for, to show everyone, no matter their size or condition, to at least - Try.I'm going to do the Firm 30 next - I have a feeling I'm going to buy this one.  See my other reviews, I'm picky - I pick favorites and compare all others.There is a water stain on the floor that was bugging me because the camera kept going to it.  LOL!  I kept trying to see if it was a design and what was it.  LOL!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I wanted something that was short and gives a fairly decent workout.  This is great.  It isn't the hardest of hers but it's also not the easiest.  If all you have is a half hour this is great.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Been walking with Leslie 2 years and getting fitter. Wanted to up my game so purchased this DVD and it doesn't disappoint. Alternate days doing cardio and strength training. Her upbeat commentary makes me want to exercise. Suitable for a variety of weights. Recommend for everyone.
summary: Up your game for faster weight loss
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: the tone part of this dvd isn't much to speak of but the walk part is great and dvd worth trying
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: NOTE:  I received a free copy of this DVD to review for the web site Metapsychology Online Reviews; please see that site for a more detailed version of my review.In this video, instructor Leslie Sansone adds a strength-training component to her usual aerobic walk.  Walk It Off in 30 Days is designed to be a "specific plan" that is used for 30 days.  Sansone suggests using the walk segment of the program on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays and the strength segment section on Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays (presumably, Sundays are a rest day).The Main Menu for this DVD reads as follows:  Introduction to the 30 Day Plan--Burn 30 Workout (Play/Play with Music Only)--Firm 30 Workout (Play/Play with Music Only).  For both workout routines, Sansone teaches live in a large, bright studio with about ten different background exercises.  Dumbbells and a mat are needed for the strength routine.  Each workout is described briefly below.BURNThis is the cardio workout, and it is fairly typical of most of Sansone's walking routines, if perhaps a bit more upbeat overall.  Sansone and a few of the other background exercisers use 2-pound hand weights throughout.  It begins with a 5-minute warm-up, and as Sansone usually does, she introduces her basic walking moves, including the walk (actually a march), knees up, hamstring curls, side steps, tap outs, front kicks, and the addition of a cha-cha.  Some of the new moves included in this workout are transitioning from the side-to-side step into a skater (adding a small hop if desired) and a bouncing move with fist pump.  At the 25-minute mark, Sansone starts to bring the heart rate back down, and she concludes the routine with approximately 2 minutes of cool-down moves.FIRMThe strength routine begins with an aerobic-style warm-up.  This includes Sansone's typical walking moves, plus a bit of impact with some light jogs.  Using 5-pound weights for the strength work, Sansone starts with squats, performing each move slowly and deliberately but also doing several different variations, including close stance, wide stance, plié squat, and squat with overhead press, followed by a static lunge on both sides.  Moving on to the upper body, Sansone works her way through single arm rows, one-arm tricep kick-backs, double arm rows, reverse flies, bicep curls, overhead presses, and then alternating bicep curls.  She concludes the standing work with a final set of squats.  At the 20-minute mark, Sansone transitions to the floor for chest flies and chest press.  Next comes core work, which includes an abs crunch while holding one dumbbell, additional crunch variations, a short version of the Pilates 100, and then bird-dog on hands and knees.  For a final stretch, Sansone returns to her back and stretches out flat for about 30 seconds--that's it.Sansone has a friendly, chatty personally that will be immensely appealing to many, but others may be a bit put off, especially during the strength workout, which has frequent pauses between sets to accommodate Sansone's chatter.  However, this video definitely delivers what it promises--i.e., an option to engage in cardio and strength training on alternate days.  For those looking for an easy-to-follow program, this DVD would be ideal; the level of the workouts are easy to modify, making it appropriate for beginners to low intermediate exercisers.
summary: Complete fitness program includes both cardio and strength component
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: If you have watched Leslie for awhile, you know the basic workout  This is improved, in my opinion, because of the casting choices, wardrobe, studio, sound.  Its a nice video. I am not motivated to do it every single day, but I do like it better than the 30 day shred because its gentler, friendlier, and nice cardio boost.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: To be fair, I have not gone through the strength portion of this DVD so I can't comment on that. I was pleasantly surprised by the cardio portion though. Most of Leslie's videos are not intended for advanced exercisers (even for our "off days"), but the pace for this walk was much quicker than what I have previously experienced. I like her 5 Fat Burning Miles video because it delivered a faster pace throughout the entire video, not just for a mile or so. This is Leslie on Red Bull! I like the faster pace and it made me sweat, even at the much shorter time frame. (I typically use 2 or 3 lb hand weights throughout her walking workouts.) As someone who exercises regularly at much higher intensity levels, this is going to be a very nice addition to my "off day" DVD rotation.UPDATE (10/15/2013): I thought I would update my initial review since I have now completed the "Firm" (aka Strength) portion of the DVD. I actually did the Firm segment immediately after the Cardio segment, and I enjoyed it. It didn't tire me out but I definitely felt like I worked out. The exercises are very basic and easy to follow, but they are effective if done properly. That pretty much keeps the philosophy of her walking workouts -- nothing complicated. I liked that she had a brief, but fast paced, cardio warm up at the beginning. There are lots of squats and lunge positions; upper body work  is done from a "lean-forward" lunge position. The floor work includes chest and core exercises. Again, simple and traditional moves. All in all, this is my favorite Leslie Sansone DVD (although I only have about 3 others), and I would recommend to anyone looking for a "more complete" Leslie Sansone workout.
summary: More challenging than her usual videos
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I love Leslie and ALL her walkers! They are all encouraging and happy while working out which helps me to press on to the end. And the proof I find for using these dvds in by how much healthier I feel and by watching the pounds come off in a healthy way! Thanks Leslie and leaders!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I just love leslie sansone. The only grip I have on her new workout is that she does not show real people who have lost weight. She now has people who are in shape exercising and I always loved hearing the inspirational stories of people who have lost weight using her workouts. That being said leslie has really out did herself this time. using her tried and true moves she has brought in a whole new set of moves and music that keeps you going. if you still find it easy add hand weights and ankle weights to toughen it up and enjoy.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Good workout better than her usual DVD.  Really like toning part of work , the music is ok  thank you .
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Warning: this workout is moderate intensity--so if you are restricted to low intensity workouts, this one may not be suitable for you.I love love love Leslie's workouts, and this one is my new favorite!! It is easy to fit into your schedule & only requires 30 minutes a day. The burn 30 segment contains a lot of her basic moves--which are easy to follow (I'm very uncoordinated); but the 30 minute cardio walk is at a pretty fast pace & you will sweat.  The firm 30 segment is EXCELLENT!!  Works out all your major muscles!  If you're trying to lose weight--I think you WILL see results if you follow the 30 day plan (& eat healthier).I am not trying to lose weight--just maintain, & I use Leslie's workouts almost everyday.  However, I do need to tone my muscles, so I think I will give the 30 day plan a try!  I did the firm segment today, and I'm feeling a little bit sore--but in a good way (not in an overwhelming way).Some of my other favorite Leslie workouts are: Burn Body Fat; Belly Blasting Walk; Ultimate 5 Day Walk Plan; and 3 Mega Miles (all of these workouts also include segments of strength training and/or toning segments).Bottom line: if you are a healthy individual (no physical restrictions) & you simply love Leslie's workouts due to her easy to follow moves, then this DVD is a MUST to add to your collection. Enjoy!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I always enjoy Leslie's DVD's and this DVD touch every muscle seen and unseen, It really give you a great workout!!!! Thanks Leslie and keep them coming!!!! I have been a walker for three or more years and your DVD's keep me going in between, thanks!!!!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: All of Leslies CDs are accessable by pretty much everyone who can walk. Stick with it and you can't help but significantly improve you condition
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I am in love with this workout. I stumbled upon Leslie via some youtube workouts and loved that they were simple and I could do it inside when the weather was crap. These 2 workouts get it done. I love the variety of people working out. I love the simplicity with option to make bigger movements/burn more. The strength training one gets all the jiggley bits. Love that they are 30 min. and between the 2 get the job done.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: This is a nice workout. I do both workouts when I exercise. It only takes an hour to get both your cardio and firming workouts in.
summary: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off in 30 Days
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Leslie's new workout is a nice coordinated pair of 30 minute workouts to alternate--fast paced walking in one workout and strength training in the second workout.  The walking workout is 30 minutes, including a warm up and cool down.  The pace is consistently fast and the moves include Leslie's traditional four walk moves, plus a few add-ons like skaters and cha-chas.  I like the fast pace--it kept my heart rate up.  The set is nice and bright and the music is energetic.  The strength workout includes a cardio warm up and then a complete set of moves for legs, arms, and abs.  She does a fair number of squats and lunges, then moves into work for the arms.  The workout finishes on the floor with some additional moves for arms and chest, and then ab work.The is a good basic set that includes all you need for a good exercise program.  I like the 30 minute pacing because you can easily fit in one or do both for a longer workout.
summary: 2 Workouts to Alternate-- Strength and Cardio!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I love working out with Leslie Sansone -- she has put out a LOT of low-impact walking workouts, and she makes getting up and exercising easy and unintimidating!  This DVD has two 30-minute workouts, or you can do both for a longer workout.  As Leslie says, you can't do this wrong!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Can't say enough about how amazing this DVD is.  It is fast paced and you get the results you are looking for.  I not only bought a copy for me, but I got a copy for some friends as well.  It came in the mail on the same day I was leaving for vacation (I was praying that it would).  So my friends and family used it the entire week that we were on vacation.  We had a blast.  I must say, the first week I used it, I worked muscles I didn't know that existed in my body, which was a good thing and I still use even though the 30 days are up.  You will have so much fun with this one.  She has you doing the Cha Cha and double tap outs and you name it, you do it, and then you have the lean 30.  I didn't think I was going to be able to do it, but I used five pounds weights the entire time and my arms are looking great.  So I encourage you to get this one and Step, Step and Run Run Run with Leslie Sansone and the gang.  It's amazing and it is a great DVD to add to your collection.  If you are looking for something fun and fast paced, this is it.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I loved the first part. But the lifting the weights was too slow for me. It needed to be a little more upbeat.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I love  all of her dvds. I just added this one to my collection of L.S.It's a great low impact video that doesn't hurt my knees in any way. That's the primary reason why her videos work for me. You get a great workout without stress to the knees.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Clearly the best music of the "Just Walk" series.  Just wish the cardio segment was a bit longer.  Otherwise, reset the computer or your DVD player to extend the time if you want a longer session.
summary: WALK IT OFF IN 30 DAYS....(GIVE OR TAKE)
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: **Menu Screen**- Introduction to the DVD- Burn 30 Workout (with or without music ) 30 mins- Firm 30 Workout (with or without music) 30 mins******Burn 30 Workout******This consist of high-intensity aerobics. They are NOT miles. This is just a full blunt workout for 30 minutes. The major moves consist of bouncing with a fist pump in the air, jogging, the run-run-run, and a new move called 'skater' where you combine side step with a foot behind the other. You can use hand-weights if you want.PROS- Clock: The clock does show up, but only when 10 minutes remain in the workout and it stays until the end. I guess there's really no need for a clock. We all know how long the workout lasts.- Key execution movies: Leslie is excellent when executing her moves. She does not surprise you or switch legs- Music: The music is great. It forces you to be on key becuase the beat is very catchy. When you first do it, it may not seem like the music reaches out to you, but you have to give yourself a chance to get used to it. The music makes me feel young. The last song before the cool down is THE JAM! It makes you feel like you're on this serious mission. :p- Her Friends: All are like college-based age with one woman being Leslie's age (just guessing) and then a much older woman is in the back. I felt sorry for the older woman in the back. This workout was clearly not within her abilities. She could not keep up entirely. One other thing about them is that to Leslie's left (right side of the screen) are two women that are using weight. These women are like robots! They motivate me to push myself. There was one time I was tired of holding the weights, but when the scene switched to them still carrying it, I picked mines back up.CONS- None*******Firm 30 Workout*******This consist if toning your arms, thighs, stomach, and butt. The first part is a warm up with some brief jogging. You get right to work with squats of wide legs and legs close together. There is A LOT of squatting and lunges. I cannot stand lunges. So, I just substitute them with more squats. You'll do some lunge stances in position and then work on the arms. She'll rotate legs, but it gets you tired quick.I normally do not like floor work, but when it's with Leslie I'm more confident about it. One the floor, she'll start with the weights raised high over your chest and then tell you to bring your elbows out and in. Then she'll do chest raises with the weights. She'll then work hard on the stomach with the little crunches. The stretch is pretty short but involves leaning on one need with the opposite hand pointing out, and the last stretch is on your back with your arms over your head laying FLAT out.PROS- Clock: By the time you get on the floor the clock will appear and remain for the last 10 minutes.- You'll get a very good workout for the legs, especially when she gets you to lean in the lunge stance while doing the arm workout.CONS (VERY minor cons)- The music for this session is very nice. But the second (and last) song repeats 3 to 4 times in a row. This last song actually makes you feel like you're on a fancy beach somewhere in another country. It's really nice, but it can get old after a while. I usually have a big ear for music.- As soon as she says that you've finished the standing workout, QUICKLY get out that yoga mat, becuase she does not give you enough time to set that up. So either have already in place or close by.- I felt like the arm session was not competitive enough, but that could be due to the pounds I had. I only had 2 to 5 pounds. I would upgrade it to 6 or 7 pounds****OTHER INFO*****I did the workout as suggested, doing them everyday. For the Burn 30, I burned between 188-205 calories. For Firm 30 I burned 89-92 calories.Because this workout is set up for 30-day challenge, having it only motivates me to actually do it everyday. That's the plus side of having it.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: What an awesome DVD Leslie does it again! I so much enjoy this DVD and it keeps you moving, which I like and I'm sweating like crazy and I've only done the first part of it:-).This is a GREAT workout and I've been working out with Leslie for about 19 years now, but this one is off the hook!!!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I was guilty of not using this DVD as it was intended to be used:  Monday, Wednesday and Friday - cardio, then on Tuesday, Thursday and Friday - strength-training.I knew this DVD had a cardio segment and a firming or strength training segment, but I stayed merely with cardio segment for months on end, using it only when I wanted a lighter cardio workout than the 5-mile workout Leslie is famous for and which I often prefer and rely upon.Realizing how out-of-shape finally I was brought me to consider doing the strengthening aspect of this DVD,  (At 64 years of age), I decided it was time to face the music, literally and figuratively, and take the second step:  do the strength training program for gosh sakes.My first session with the weights was good but a bit painful.  I used 20 pounds on each hand and sweated more than I ever sweat on any of Leslie's cardio workouts.  I also hurt a lot afterward because I hadn't built up to using 20 pounds.  I hadn't been strength training for almost two years.  I overdid it on my first try.  The music on the DVD is light and pleasant, however, and it really helps make the exercises be an easeful experience.My second session with the strength training portion of this DVD went much better.  I cut the pounds I was using in half, using only 10 pounds in each hand.  This workout definitely is for beginners or for intermediate workout practitioners. I can't imagine a fit and regular exerciser being at all intimidated by this workout.  None of the exercises are difficult particularly or protracted, but all of them are useful, helpful and necessary, no question.The only segment in the strength training I'm continuing to avoid, however, is the last one which involves getting on my knees and on all fours.  This segment only lasts about two minutes, but I have six-year-old double-knee replacements, and I don't like putting any kind of pressure against these knees.  I'm not ready to get a redo surgery.The point I want to make is that I really have enjoyed the strength-training part of the DVD, even though I avoided doing it for an unnecessarily long time.The cardio program goes by in an instant. It's a no brainer.  It's only 30 light minutes and it's lots of fun.  The gang Leslie grabbed for this program is a great group, pleasant-looking and competent without showy show biz personalities.This program is so do-able, it sets you up for being able to do more and more.  I highly recommend it.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I was really looking forward to getting this DVD but it's quite a disappointment.There are 2-30 minute workouts on this DVD with nothing much new added except that the strength training is a lot more in-depth than other DVD's in this series.Speaking of the strength training component, there is little or no mention of proper breathing technique, while doing these exercises. As a former strength trainer myself, I think this is a big omission. For beginners, they may not be aware that you are suppose to exhale on the exertion part not the other way around. I'm surprised that this was missed, it's such a basic for strength training that IS important and should definitely be mentioned a few times during this kind of workout.I also REALLY miss Leslie's "old" pals not being along for the exercises. Couldn't at least 1 or 2 of her regulars been along for this dvd?  She has the studio filled with "20 something's" now and that I think is a big mistake. I disliked the music in this one too.One of the things I particularly liked about her earlier dvd's, was the emphasis on fitness being for EVERYONE. That she had walkers with her from a range of ages. And given Leslie's own age, I'm surprised and disappointed that she didn't keep this in mind, with this new DVD.I probably will be passing this one along to our local library.My fav is still: the Intensity Walk that features 3 workouts that are effective, fun and varied.And these workout DO feature walkers from 20 year olds all the way to those in their 70's. That's more like it!!!
summary: Not One of My Favs from Leslie
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I love this workout. I love the new set and the walkers all look nicely coordinated and the new set up is visually appealing to me. I just wish the walking (Burn 30) workout was longer! I get the whole "30" theme, but I'd love to see a future version of this with a 45 minute walking option and the same length firming segment. My favorite workouts tend to be 45-60 minutes since that's about all that my schedule permits. I've been doing this entire DVD in one day, a couple of days a week, in rotation with other workouts, instead of alternating burn and firm days.I highly recommend this one!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Of course there are the old moves. There are some new moves such as skaters. The first segment was a fast paced 30 minute segment that got my heart rate up and sweating. It was nice to have the walk clock when you were getting close to done. The toning segment did leave me feeling worked out. I just wish the walking was longer and the toning a little less annoying. Leslie says every move you make. There is no reason to say row over and over for what feels like fifty times.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: This is a good one!  fun - not too hard or too easy.  I use WW and it gets my points.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: She's got a great personality and her workout is fun to do.  The strength training part (Firm 30), oh my goodness, IS a WORKOUT! If you have not done strength training in addition to a regular workout then this one will make you SORE the first time!  I know it did make me sore but after a few times your body adjusts and it does get easier.  I like her but had not heard of her before I bought this dvd.  I needed a change from my Denise Austin Fat Burning Walk which is a good workout as well.  Leslie's steps are easy to follow in the workout and you will sweat!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I own several DVD's by Leslie Sansone and this one gets you sweating faster while packing the workout into a half hour session. The alternating "burn" and "firm" days makes a good changeup and keeps it from getting boring.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: This is another excellent 30 minute, 2 mile work out.  Leslie Sansone dvds work for all ages and fitness levels.
summary: Leslie Sansone dvds are the best on the market.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: This is a great DVD! It is broken into two sections. The first is a 30 minute aerobic workout that is fast paced and upbeat. Leslie "tweaks" some of her classic moves (walking, sidestep, knee-lift and kick). I have gotten a good workout from it. The second section is also 30 minutes but it has a strength training focus using hand weights. She starts this session with an aerobic warm-up and then works into doing strength training - standing. When this is complete she works into strength training on a mat. This too, gave me a good workout. Leslie's recommendation is to do the aerobic sections Monday, Wednesday and Friday and the Strength training, Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday, taking Sunday's off.
summary: Walk It Off in 30 Days - Aerobics and Strength Training
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: This dvd is great!  Leslie does not disappoint as she kicks it up a notch with the routine.  I have always appreciated her positive approach to exercise.  I definitely need it to keep myself inspired.  Looking forward to see what she has coming out next :)
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Love the exercise walking tape.  Great for anyone over 50 also. Not to hard and easy to keep up with.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Because of a total hip replacement, I need to keep the strength up in my legs.  In the winter, I can't really walk outside since I don't want to fall on the ice and snow.  Leslie Sansone gives a great workout that you can adjust to your own needs.  I had never worked with a toning band before and really have been enjoying the one that comes with the DVD.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I must have at least 10 of her DVDs.......and use them all. THIS ONE gives real results and is pleasant to use no matter how many times I do it......(2 months or more)  And I like looking at that cute Nick as well!! Put him on more of your stuff, Leslie! LOL
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I can't get enough of her walking programs. Some are 1 mile or 15 minutes long, Others longer depending on how long you want to walk. She makes the time fly by and I enjoy her conversations with those who walk with her and her encouragement to those who walk with her and those playing the CD. Go Leslie!!!
summary: I just love Leslie Sanson CDs
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: This video is just OK.  The work out is only 30 minutes but it is too intense for someone just starting to exercise.  I typically use this only once a week (at most).  I definitely wouldn't want to do it every day for 30 days.  I much prefer the 5 day walk video
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I got this expecting a typical Leslie walk it off workout...and in a lot of ways it is...She has a 30 min walking workout and a 30 min firming workout on it. The walking workout is a typical Leslie walking workout...she uses some newer moves like "The Skater" and stuff which I really enjoyed. The firming workout is actually alot more intense than I thought it would be...it actually wore me out (in a good way) and usually Leslie's stuff doesn't do that...
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I've seen other reviews when people are annoyed by Leslie and her energy.  Who cares!  If you want to lose some weight get moving that is the best thing for you.  I lost 25 lbs due to exercising and diet (no diet fads or pills) and Leslie Sansone 1 mile walk.  I like this walk because it only takes 30 minutes for firming or burning. And it's not difficult to follow along.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: However, whoever did her makeup in this video needs some instruction.  Leslie does a great job of inspiring folks to walk, but its hard watching her so heavily made up that her eyes look like she is sporting 2 black eyes.  Otherwise a great buy.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I really like this DVD. The music is fresh and the moves are challenging. There are two different workouts on the DVD: the walking program, Burn 30, and the strength program, Firm 30. Leslie suggests doing them on alternating days for 30 days. Let's look at both segments:Burn 30 is a fast-paced walk featuring several boosts, including hops, the cha-cha, and skaters, which really get the heart rate up, as well as a cool-down and quick stretch. One thing this program does not have that I wish it had are mile markers. I'd guess this walk is close to 2.5 miles, but that's just a guess. (This is one reason for my 4-star rating.) I enjoy the workout and it goes by quickly. After twenty minutes, a timer pops up in the corner counting down the last 10 minutes of the workout.Firm 30 is the toning portion of the workout and calls for the use of  hand weights (I use 3 pounds). This program calls for a lot of lunges and squats, but you can definitely modify - a lot of the lunges are actually done while working the upper body. I injured my ACL a few years ago, so I have to be very careful with my knees, and this workout has not given me any problems at all. But do be aware of the legwork if you have knee trouble. After the legs and arms, there is about 10 minutes of floor work for the abs, obliques, and back end. Firm 30 is a challenging workout, especially if you're new to that type of exercise.I do this workout a few times a week (about every other day), and I choose to do the entire DVD at once. I am really glad that Leslie has put out a workout like this that includes strength training. That type of exercise can be redundant, unexciting, and even intimidating, but Leslie makes it accessible and energizing. I do miss seeing some of the regular walkers, though, and I really wish there were mile markers. Overall, a great workout!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Design for being short on time, I like how it's separated in cardio and strength. Worth a buy, Leslie looks exactly the same as 3 decades ago
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I love the fact that this DVD has a walking portion and also a firming portion.  Her workouts go fast and are not so hard on all the joints as the other workouts I have tried.  Her voice is kind of annoying, but I just blast music while I workout.  I highly recommend this video!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Have Lots of Leslie's DVDs.  Recently go this one.  First it is NOT new, cover maybe new, but recording is Not. I don't even think its HD.  This DVD, like several others I have, has the option of Music Only.  I wish ALL her DVDs have this option because really I get very tired of hearing here ceaseless Chit-Chat while I walk and believe me I do walk with her a lot. The Music is ok, better than some for sure.  Now I like this DVD.  It is 2 segments.  The first is a half hour of walking - no mile breaks-no change of walkers - just 30 minutes of standard Leslie walking.  Its the only DVD I have that just goes 30 minutes straight of walking.  I like that for a change.  The second segment has Free Weights, and I have never had this on one of her DVDs before.  Sure lots of stretchy bands, but this 30 minutes segment features Free Weights and a real muscle workout - with some walking.  I like that a lot.  In fact I have been looking for some muscle work and am glad I got this.  All in all, I like it.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Love this workout.  I ordered it just because I have several of Leslie's other workouts.  I have not done them for a while because I always buy new workouts to keep it fresh.  I really did not expect it to be much different from the others except for music and clothing, but it is fantastic.  The 30-minute BURN IT workout uses a lot more of a variety of steps and it goes so much faster than the previous workouts.  The alternate day FIRM IT exercises pass by just as quickly doing all parts of the body with light weights or however heavy you want.  It seems more like 15 minutes than 30.  Great Job Leslie.  Thank you for a powerfully fun workout.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I love that there are two work outs on this disk, one to tone and one to gain cardio fitness.  I would have liked having two aditional work outs, because it gets repetative if doing the two work outs for 30 days.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Love Leslie Sansone. Leslie makes it so easy to get in a great workout.always fast and fun, fun , fun.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: This DVD kicks my butt and I love it.  It's fun and yet you break a sweat.  I love 90% of Leslies work out DVDS
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Another great workout from Leslie.  This time she uses weights which is a first. One part is cardio  and the other strength training.  A great buy.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: this is a really good work out you have 30 min of walking 2 miles and then 30 min of toning you can do them separate days or do it all at once for one good work out.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I'm a Leslie Sansone fan, but this is one of my favorites.  This workout is fun because of Leslie and her walkers.  The time flies, and I got an honest workout without killing myself.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: Leslie just gets better!  This is two FANTASTIC 2-mile walks utilizing weights with aerobic activity. While low impact, there is plenty of fat-burning in only :30 of work.  Shipping is fast and the product is exactly as described.  Will come shopping again!
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I've only used the walking portions of the video, and they involve mostly standard Leslie moves, with a few of the newer ones (skaters, etc) thrown in. The music is decent, if somewhat abrupt- I still don't understand why, after all these years, Leslie and her people haven't gotten it together musically, to get songs of the right length and the right speed, to make transitioning between portions of the exercises smoother. The cast is a bunch of people I have never seen before- in one way, this is good because they include 2 guys and an older lady, but most of them look like 22-year olds who exercise for a living.  You can tell these exercises are really not that big a deal for them, unlike those of us at home who genuinely need to get into better shape.  I miss Mary Kay, Linda, Carol, and some of the other old-timers, and even the new peppy people (Bri, Nikki, Carrie, etc.).  We'll see what Leslie's next video brings.
summary: It's not my favorite, but it will do.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I have been buying Leslie Sansone DVDs for about 10 years and this is one of her best. It is peppy, challenging without being TOO much and works all of the muscles.
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: The best ever! Fantastic music at last! Best walking since I walk with leslie! And then finally a beautiful group, the study is the most beautiful of those used up to now! I can not wait to buy the 5 miles that will be released in September! thanks leslie continues thanks
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days

reviewText: I was somewhat apprehensive about Leslie's newest venture since most of the walkers were younger and her last workout had younger walkers with more complex choreography, but this walk is quite nice.  I haven't tried the weight workout yet, but the aerobic 30 minute workout is quite nice and goes quickly.  Love the 10 minute counter at the end.  And she did add one walker with some age - GO LOUISE!!!
summary: Great workout - more of a challenge
Title: Leslie Sansone: Walk It Off In 30 Days
